Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SA-hepcidin1 (Cys-rich 31%; 4S=S, UCSS1a; natural AMPs;  fish, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide most resembles (88.5% similarity)P. sarana Hepcidin.  Mol. Wt: 3009.624. GRAVY=-0.24.  Active against S. aureus (MIC 50 uM), Gram- V. fluvialis (MIC 25 uM), V. anguillarum (MIC 50 uM), V. alginolyticus (MIC 50 uM), V-parahaemloyticus (MIC >50 uM), and E. coli. The antibacterial activity of SA-hepcidin1 is stronger than that of SA-hepcidin2. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Gui L, Zhang P, Zhang Q, Zhang J. 2016
Literature Information.Title: Two hepcidins from spotted scat (Scatophagus argus) possess antibacterial and antiviral functions in vitro
